headlines.title: UK economy shrank sharply in April as Trump tariffs kicked in
headlines.description: The U.K. economy shrank sharply in April as global trade tariffs and domestic tax rises kicked in, data showed Thursday.
headlines.explanation: The headline implies that the UK economy shrank because of Trump tariffs, without providing evidence of a direct causal relationship between the two.

headlines.title: London-bound Air India flight with more than 240 aboard crashes in Ahmedabad, India
headlines.description: A Boeing 787 crashed into a residential area in Ahmedabad city five minutes after taking off. The flight was bound for London's Gatwick Airport. There were more than 240 people onboard.

headlines.title: Plane carrying 242 people crashes outside airport in western Indian city of Ahmedabad
headlines.description: An Air India passenger plane with 242 people on board has crashed shortly after taking off from an airport in India’s western city of Ahmedabad.

headlines.title: UN atomic board censures Iran and Tehran says it will establish a new nuclear site
headlines.description: The U.N. nuclear watchdog’s board of governors has formally found that Iran isn’t complying with its nuclear obligations for the first time in 20 years.

headlines.title: Stoxx 600, FTSE, DAX, CAC 40
headlines.description: Join CNBC for live updates on European markets.

headlines.title: Why 2 Chinese aircraft carriers are operating in the Pacific together for the first time
headlines.description: Japan this week confirmed that two Chinese aircraft carriers have operated together for the first time in the Pacific.

headlines.title: Arnold Schwarzenegger's love child Joseph Baena frozen out of family photo with half-siblings at premiere
headlines.description: Arnold Schwarzenegger had a family reunion at the premiere of season two of his Netflix action comedy Fubar on Wednesday - but one of his children got the cold shoulder.

headlines.title: Tyrese Haliburton, Pacers bench carry Indiana to NBA Finals Game 3 win vs. Thunder
headlines.description: The All-Star guard had his best game of the NBA Finals, and reserve Bennedict Mathurin scored a game-high 27 for underdog Indiana.

headlines.title: Spending Review 'renewing Britain' or 'reckless splurge'
headlines.description: Reaction to the chancellor's Spending Review dominates the front pages on Thursday.
headlines.explanation: The headline presents only two extreme options ('renewing Britain' or 'reckless splurge') without considering any middle ground or alternative possibilities.

headlines.title: What to know about 'No Kings' protests against Trump's policies on Saturday
headlines.description: Opponents of President Donald Trump’s administration are set to rally in nearly 2,000 cities and towns this weekend.

headlines.title: Stock market today: Live updates
headlines.description: The Nasdaq Composite jumped nearly 1%, also coming within striking distance of a fresh record. The Dow popped about 0.14%.
headlines.content:
Futures tied to the S&P 500 and the Nasdaq 100 hit record highs Friday, surpassing all-time intraday highs and mounting a stunning comeback from the lows set in April.
This comes ahead of a data deluge, including inflation numbers, with the market ov... [1224 chars]

headlines.title: China, U.S. confirm details of their trade deal, Beijing says
headlines.description: The statement came after U.S. President Donald Trump said that both sides had signed a trade deal, without providing further details.
headlines.content:
The U.S. and China have confirmed details of a trade framework that seeks to allow rare earth exports and easing of tech restrictions, according to a statement released by China's Ministry of Commerce Friday afternoon.
China will review and approve e... [1801 chars]

headlines.title: Japan executes ‘Twitter killer’ who murdered and dismembered nine people
headlines.description: Japan has executed a man dubbed the “Twitter killer,” who was convicted of murdering and dismembering nine people, mostly women, in the country’s first use of capital punishment in nearly three years.
headlines.content:
Tokyo CNN —
Japan has executed a man dubbed the “Twitter killer,” who was convicted of murdering and dismembering nine people, mostly women, in the country’s first use of capital punishment in nearly three years.
Takahiro Shiraishi, 34, was hanged Fr... [3211 chars]

headlines.title: Stock Market Today: Dow, S&P Live Updates for June 27
headlines.description: Asian stocks and European futures advanced, and a gauge of global equities reached another record high, on trade-deal optimism and increased expectations for Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts this year.
headlines.content:
Asian stocks and European futures advanced, and a gauge of global equities reached another record high, on trade-deal optimism and increased expectations for Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts this year.

headlines.title: Supreme Court meets Friday to decide birthright citizenship and other cases
headlines.description: The Supreme Court is meeting Friday to decide the final six cases of its term, including President Donald Trump’s bid to enforce his executive order denying birthright citizenship to U.S.
headlines.content: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Supreme Court is meeting Friday to decide the final six cases of its term, including President Donald Trump’s bid to enforce his executive order denying birthright citizenship to U.S.-born children of parents who are in the coun... [3162 chars]

headlines.title: 'Dukes of Hazzard' Actor Was 79
headlines.description: Rick Hurst, the actor known for playing Deputy Cletus Hogg on 'The Dukes of Hazzard', has died. He was 79.
headlines.content:
Rick Hurst, the actor known for playing Deputy Cletus Hogg on The Dukes of Hazzard, has died. He was 79.
According to the actor’s wife Candace Kaniecki, he died unexpectedly on Thursday in Los Angeles, TMZ reported. His cause of death was not immedia... [2190 chars]

headlines.title: Hawaiian Airlines reports 'cybersecurity event;' no flight disruptions
headlines.description: Hawaiian Airlines assures the community that flights remain safe and on schedule despite a recent cybersecurity incident affecting their IT systems.
headlines.content:
HONOLULU (Island News) – Hawaiian Airlines reported that a “cybersecurity event” has affected some of its IT systems.
On Thursday morning, Hawaiian Airline officials confirmed that flights are operating safely and as scheduled.
The Hawaii Department ... [1215 chars]

headlines.title: Wander Franco found guilty of sexually abusing minor
headlines.description: Rays shortstop Wander Franco was found guilty of sexual abuse of a minor in his native Dominican Republic. Franco, 24, was sentenced to two years of suspended prison time, according to reporter Juan Arturo Recio.
headlines.content:
Wander Franco was found guilty of sexual abuse of a minor in his native Dominican Republic. However, the Rays shortstop dodged jail time despite pleas from prosecutors to put him behind bars.
Franco was sentenced to a two-year suspended prison senten... [3415 chars]

headlines.title: Wander Franco: Tampa Bay Rays player found guilty in sexual abuse case, imposed two-year suspended sentence
headlines.description: A court in Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic, found baseball player Wander Franco — of the Tampa Bay Rays — guilty of abuse and sexual exploitation of a minor and imposed a two-year prison sentence, though the sanction was suspended with the restriction that he not approach minors.
headlines.content:
